author: Sabrina Valle
title: Petrobras CEO Seeks to Recoup $1.8 Billion From Graft Losses
text:
Petroleo Brasileiro SA is seeking to recover as much as $1.8 billion lost as part of Brazil’s biggest corruption scandal.
“We have this expectation, and I think the prosecutor’s office shares this view, to recover that sum,” Chief Executive Officer Aldemir Bendine said of graft-related write-offs during a press conference at company headquarters in Rio de Janeiro on Friday.
The world’s most indebted oil company has been at the center of the scandal, dubbed Carwash because police discovered a service station used to launder cash. Last year, Petrobras had its first operating loss since 1991 because of fuel sold below import costs and the write-offs.
Petrobras, as the company is known, has recouped almost 300 million reais from illegal offshore accounts of former executives after they became the state’s witnesses and agreed to revert the proceeds of corruption. That’s just a fraction of the 6.2 billion reais ($1.8 billion) the company wrote off for 2014.
Bendine also said Friday that, while Petrobras has been holding meetings with bankers to discuss the potential initial public offering of its fuel distribution unit, the company has yet to pick a firm to lead the transaction.
